definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Our instructor told us to keep the room locked .
sentences.chinese: 我們的教導員告訴我們把那間房鎖上。

sentences.english: The door held fast, obviously locked.
sentences.chinese: 門關得緊緊的，顯然鎖上了。

sentences.english: The lock took with a click.
When he wakes up he finds that he is locked the handcuffs by the guard, Owen and electric edition disappear suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 貴仁醒來被警衛鎖上手銬，歐文及電版不翼而飛。

sentences.english: I must just remind you to lock the safe.
sentences.chinese: 我一定得提醒您把保險箱鎖上。

sentences.english: He put the gift into his locker and locked it.
sentences.chinese: 他把禮物放人更衣箱然後鎖上它。

sentences.english: Make sure to lock the pen door after feeding the animals.
sentences.chinese: 喂完動物請記得鎖上圈門。

sentences.english: The door was locked on the outside.
Lock the pantry door and remember guest supplies are very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 鎖上內倉門記住客用品是非常貴的。

sentences.english: Means of access at Podium Level 3 or above may be locked at all times.
sentences.chinese: 業權人可鎖上位於第三層及以上的通道。

sentences.english: The girl tried the door to see if it was locked or not.
sentences.chinese: 女孩推了推門，看看是否鎖上了。

sentences.english: To their dismay, the door was locked.
sentences.chinese: 使他們驚慌的是，門已被鎖上了。

sentences.english: People in small Iowa towns locked their doors for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 在愛荷華的小鎮上，家家戶戶第一次鎖上了門。
她用鎖鎖上了桌子抽屜。

sentences.english: Hutchinson has the hotel manager override all the locks.
sentences.chinese: 漢金森叫酒店經理從電腦上鎖上了所有門鎖。

sentences.english: Every night, when we closed up before going to bed, we never lock the doors.
sentences.chinese: 每天晚上，睡覺前關大門的時候，總是沒將鑰匙鎖上。
